name: Detective Mouse and the Cattynip Dilemma
name_original: Detective Mouse and the Cattynip Dilemma
description:
MI 445 Project 1 - Detective Mouse and the Cattynip Dilemma (Ver. 0.3)

Created by Vy Luong for the MSU Game Design & Development I course, using a package of tutorial assets and pre-built scenes.

Game Description: Detective Constable Mouse has to give up his precious weekends to go investigate a bank robbery case, 

My Work (Significant modifications)

Art Modifications (Blender)

- Player 3D model (Detective Mouse)

- Enemy 3D model (Dr. Cat)

- Environment 3D models (4 Buildings)

- Prop 3D model (Traffic Light)

// Goals: No 2D character sprites or player animations yet. Hoping to get them in next. Then I want to change the Player Projectile to Moon Cheese instead of Acorn. Then UI redesign if time.

Design Modifications (ProBuilder, Dialogue System, Unity)

- New dialogues and interactions

- Revamped main menu with additional UI buttons and pages

- A new, complete, cohesive, and interesting level with a story/gameplay centered around gathering clues to solve a mystery (with a little platforming and turn-based combat incorporated).

// Goals: Make an image of the Clues you've collected pop-up when presenting your reasoning to Dr. Cat. Depends on which combination of clues you have, a different interaction results in the final showdown.

Gameplay Modifications

- Set up a Traffic Light Switch that turns a redlight to a greenlight and stops traffic flow.

// Goals: Make it obvious whose turn (Player's turn? Enemy's turn?) cause how much damage (pop-up text?) due to which attacks (Skill name displayed and fade?).
